title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air.. Its been water damaged. 

Where to start. 

The motherboard starts. I have green light and fan spin. The apple logo on LCD cannot be seen. The screen is black.'
Where to start now?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: Voltage on backlight output?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: 2 sec im gonna chekc now

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: Shine a light through the Apple logo do you even get image? Does the board even chime?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 38084"]Shine a light through the Apple logo do you even get image? Does the board even chime?[/QUOTE]

1. No apple logo when adding light to the screen. The screen is pitch black still.
2. I get chime when pushing start button. And the apple logo on the back of the LCD is lit. But not front.
3. L7701 (I have 8,5 Voltage). On Diode mode I have 0.384.
4. C7710 (resistance mode I get 0.428) and Voltage mode 5.12V)

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: so you get backlight but no image since you state the apple logo lights up. try a known good screen check lvds cable for damage. any damage on lvds connector itself?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38086"]so you get backlight but no image since you state the apple logo lights up. try a known good screen check lvds cable for damage. any damage on lvds connector itself?[/QUOTE]

NO apple logo at all.. The screen is black.. Im following some examples now from step by step: REWA [URL]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-7_paJiwMO8[/URL]

Will reply shortly after my finds.

I have: PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT - R7731: pin1: 5.1v - pin2: 0.6v (Should be: Pin1: 8.5v, Pin2: 2.8v) According to REWA.
I have: PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT - R7715: pin1: 18.5v - pin2: 00.00v (Should be i guess here same: Pin1: 8.5v, Pin2: 2.8v) ???

On: EDP_BKLT_PWM - R7704: I get 1.7v on both pins. (Should be 3.3v on both pins)

What should I do now, change the resistors or could it be a bad U7701..?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: measure those resistors first if they are good then check u7701 on pin 5 sometimes feedback ball will be missing then you'll know you must replace the led driver and run wires. Either way if i were you id inspect the board and replace or reflow and clean anything that looks badly corroded and damaged before you go measuring. try reflowing led driver as well.

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38088"]measure those resistors first if they are good then check u7701 on pin 5 sometimes feedback ball will be missing then you'll know you must replace the led driver and run wires. Either way if i were you id inspect the board and replace or reflow and clean anything that looks badly corroded and damaged before you go measuring. try reflowing led driver as well.[/QUOTE]

Measure the resistors.. Do i need to take them off the board first? Because ive now measured them whilst on the board with voltage..

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: disconnect power from the board and measure them on the board. no need to remove them.

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38090"]disconnect power from the board and measure them on the board. no need to remove them.[/QUOTE]

1. Ok, thanks. Should it be diode mode? Resistance mode correct?
No worries. I found it on ifixit how to do it [URL="https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Use+A+Multimeter/25632#s65006"]https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+...r/25632#s65006[/URL]

2. reflow U7701 and LED driver.. How much temperature?

Ok. So now ive check the resistors: R7731 & R7715

R7731 Shows 120k (should be in schematic 200k), R7715 shows 99.6k (in schematic it says 100K, so that one is ok).

That means R7731 needs to be changed?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
no r7731 is ok if it was higher than the rated resistance then yes it would be bad. make sure you reflow the led driver until you see it move (dance around) add a good amount of flux. i always have my hot air station at 400 degrees and 80 for air. whatever works for you though.

make sure you check if ball on pin 5 is even there.

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38092"]no r7731 is ok if it was higher than the rated resistance then yes it would be bad. make sure you reflow the led driver until you see it move (dance around) add a good amount of flux. i always have my hot air station at 400 degrees and 80 for air. whatever works for you though.

make sure you check if ball on pin 5 is even there.[/QUOTE]

Thanks u for helping me out really.. im very greatful.. Love to fix my first board.. Im going to stay on this thread until we have solved this board.. Will be my first.. hope thats ok with you?

Ive checked pin 5, the ball is still there under when lookin in the microscope. but its hard to measure it, since its under the IC.

1. Ok, i start reflow the LED driver first and then we see next step. back in a bit.. Ps. How do I find the LED DRIVER?? :)

U7701 is the LED driver.. I found this video of louis: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xMhu4WyQZAA[/url]

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: make sure r7704 is measuring good too and check voltage on both pins of d7701

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: Ok, so now i have reflow the LED driver(U7701).. Now what I do?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38095"]make sure r7704 is measuring good too and check voltage on both pins of d7701[/QUOTE]

Ok. will check that now: "make sure r7704 is measuring good too and check voltage on both pins of d7701"

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38095"]make sure r7704 is measuring good too and check voltage on both pins of d7701[/QUOTE]

- R7704 measures correct: 33 ohm
- D7701 measures: 0v on both sides. DMM basically goes down slowly to 0v.. Must be the zener diode 7701 then?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: check if you get an image or backlight. if you still dont get an image either an apple logo or flashing folder by flashing light onto the apple logo on the back of the screen then check continuity on pin 18/19 of lvds connector and pin 2 of L8304 and check voltages on pin 18/19 of lvds as well.

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38099"]check if you get an image or backlight.[/QUOTE]

I checked. Still NO light on screen or image.

1. Could it be the bad Diode(D7701) since its measuring 0v..? Its should measure 0v right, since its a diode.. :) Im stupid sometimes..
2. Could it be the reflow not properly done?

I can feel we are several step closer though to get it working. Just need to lock down where the issue is. The laptop is coming on perfect. Ive tried with two working lcd screens. So its not the screen themself. Its the motherboard somewhere..

message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38099"]check if you get an image or backlight. if you still dont get an image either an apple logo or flashing folder by flashing light onto the apple logo on the back of the screen then check continuity on pin 18/19 of lvds connector and pin 2 of L8304 and check voltages on pin 18/19 of lvds as well.[/QUOTE]

Ok, im going to chekc it now. hold on pls. thx

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38099"]check if you get an image or backlight. if you still dont get an image either an apple logo or flashing folder by flashing light onto the apple logo on the back of the screen then check continuity on pin 18/19 of lvds connector and pin 2 of L8304 and check voltages on pin 18/19 of lvds as well.[/QUOTE]

- LVDS connector Pin 18/19 i get on both 000.2v (schematic says should be 3.3v) (in continuity mode I get: OL. on both pins 18/19. NO BEEP!
- pin 2 of L830: I get NO beep in continuity mode. and voltage I get the same 000.2v
- pin 1 of L830: also shows 000.2v and NO beep!

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: What about U8300...? Could that be a problem?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
Ok means the traces are blown between 18/19 and l830 solder a wire from 18/19 to pin 2 of l830 and verify that there is continuity also make sure you are checking voltages while screen is plugged in.

u8300 could be bad but since traces are blown its possible reattaching will fix it and let voltage flow again. Make sure you measure l8304 to see if its good.

Thats farenheit right, not celcius..? I have 450 celcius on mine.

Pin 18/19 shows now 3.3v both och them(with screen). Even L830 shows 3.3v.. But no logo, no light on screen still.. ?

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: Check continuity between pin 2 of l8304 and the capacitor right below it. should connect to it through pin 2 as well. Check the boardview to verify.

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="Gmorb, post: 38112"]Check continuity between pin 2 of l8304 and the capacitor right below it. should connect to it through pin 2 as well. Check the boardview to verify.[/QUOTE]

Yes, there is Continity now.. :) between pin 2 of l8304 and the capacitor right below it. 

But no light still..

message:

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message: Lets start over...Do you have 3.3 volts on pin 18/19 of the LCD connector? If so, you should have image meaning if your screen doesn’t have image, try another known good test screen. If you DON’T have 3.3 volts on pin 18/19, check to see if it makes its way to L8304 pin 1. If yes, possibly blown inductor or bad trace from inductor to screen. If NOT getting voltage on pin 1, check if EDP_PANEL_PWR is present at pin 1 of U8300

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 38115"]Lets start over...Do you have 3.3 volts on pin 18/19 of the LCD connector? If so, you should have image meaning if your screen doesn’t have image, try another known good test screen. If you DON’T have 3.3 volts on pin 18/19, check to see if it makes its way to L8304 pin 1. If yes, possibly blown inductor or bad trace from inductor to screen. If NOT getting voltage on pin 1, check if EDP_PANEL_PWR is present at pin 1 of U8300[/QUOTE]

title: No backlight on LCD - 820-3437 Macbook Air
message:
Locate XW7720, between L7701 and D7701; check if is not corroded.
If board is luquid damaged in the backlight area, change U7701...
